column5: Has anyone borrowed a van and crossed the border for their trip? What paperwork would you need to bring?Thanks for any feedback

Other guys may know better, though I'd have a notarized letter from the titled owner of the vehicle (with a photo copy of the van's title) stating you have their permission to operate the van AND an Ontario Insurance card for this van from the van owner's insurance company (or the insurance agent). Safe Travels, Rich B
We have rented a van for our trip with no problems. Have kept rental papers in van but never asked for them at border. Have been asked who van belongs to. That is all.
Be sure to get a card stating that the insurance is valid in Canada. In case of an accident or violation, that may be the first thing the officer asks for.
